title: Anthropic Vs. OpenAI: How Safety Became The Advantage In AI
description:
Daniela and Dario Amodei left OpenAI five years ago to form Anthropic, a company focused on AI safety and enterprise. Since then, the Claude creator's revenue has grown 10x annually for three straight years, with 85% coming from business customers â€” the inverse of OpenAI's consumer-heavy model. Daniela Amodei, the company's president and co-founder, has emerged as the operational counterweight to her brother Dario's technical vision. CNBC's MacKenzie Sigalos interviews Daniela and other experts, and breaks down how Anthropic quietly rose to the top of the AI race.

Chapters:
00:00 Introduction
2:03 The beginning
4:52 The enterprise bet
9:39 Compute is destiny
13:20 An identity defined by OpenAI
16:18 What could go wrong

Reporting by: MacKenzie Sigalos

He explores the evolution of design with AI, creating personalized tools like ryOS, and the importance of balancing agility and quality in crafting soulful technology.

title: â€We're Ahead of Where I Thought We'd Beâ€ â€” Gemini 3 & the ...
description: In a podcast with Sebastian Borgeaud from Google DeepMind, insights on Gemini 3 reveal a shift from infinite data to a data-limited era, emphasizing better pre-training and evaluation. The discussion covers scaling laws, continual learning, and the evolving landscape of AI research and engineering.

title: A scientist and a philosopher on the pros and cons of ...
description: In this podcast episode, philosopher Ellie Anderson and physicist Krishna Choudhary discuss the implications of AI, particularly ChatGPT. Choudhary highlights the technological advancements of large language models, while Anderson raises concerns about their impact on students and the potential underestimation of AI's dangers by corporate interests.

title: Inside OpenAI: 2026 is the year of agents, AI's biggest ...
description: In a discussion led by Alexander Embiricos, OpenAI's Codex coding agent is highlighted for its 20x growth and role in software development. Key points include the importance of human typing speed as a bottleneck, Codex's proactive capabilities, and its impact on engineering productivity.

title: Sam Altman Says Technology Is the Greatest Equalizing ...
description: In an interview on The Tonight Show, Sam Altman discusses the evolution of ChatGPT, his experience as a new father, and emphasizes that technology acts as a significant equalizing force in society. The conversation highlights the transformative potential of technology in bridging societal gaps.

title: How Cursor Is Redefining Coding In The AI Age | Aman ...
description: In a conversation at IIT Bombay, Aman Sanger, co-founder of Cursor, discusses how AI is transforming coding and software development. Cursor, valued at over $29 billion, is reshaping engineering work, education, and the future of India's IT industry as efficiency skyrockets.

title: This was the biggest debate in design this year
description: A heated debate between designers Karri Saarinen and Ryo Lu on Twitter about AI coding tools in design sparked discussions on current software design trends. The video explores both perspectives and features insights from various industry professionals, highlighting the evolving role of AI in design work.

title: Google's Gemini 3 takes the lead in AI race
description: In Episode 720 of Morning Brew Daily, hosts Neal and Toby discuss Google's recent successes, leading to its market value surpassing Microsoft's. They also touch on America's affordability crisis, Eli Lilly reaching a $1 trillion market value, and the box office success of "Wicked: For Good."

title: The End of the Designerâ€“Engineer Divide
description: Ryo Lu discusses transforming Cursor into a leading AI code editor, emphasizing the integration of design and engineering. He shares insights on rapid prototyping, designing systems, and the evolving roles of designers and engineers in tech. The conversation highlights innovative approaches to product development and collaboration.

title: The future of intelligence | Demis Hassabis (Co-founder and ...
description: In this episode, Demis Hassabis discusses the future of artificial general intelligence (AGI) with Professor Hannah Fry. Key topics include advancements in fusion energy, the importance of simulations, ethical AI development, and the balance between scientific rigor and commercialization in AI. The conversation explores the challenges and opportunities ahead.

title: The arrival of AGI | Shane Legg (co-founder of DeepMind)
description: Shane Legg, co-founder of DeepMind, discusses artificial general intelligence (AGI) in a detailed conversation with Hannah Fry. He outlines AGI levels, timelines, and its potential societal and economic impacts, including changes in work and opportunities for human flourishing. The episode emphasizes the urgency of addressing AGI's implications.

title: Google DeepMind: "The arrival of AGI"
description: The video discusses the imminent arrival of Artificial General Intelligence (AGI), featuring insights from Sam Altman and DeepMind co-founder Shane Legg. It explores potential economic futures shaped by AI, emphasizing a shift from traditional labor models. The conversation highlights the urgency and implications of AGI development.

title: Boris Cherny (Creator of Claude Code) On What Grew His ...
description: Boris Cherny, creator of Claude Code, shares insights from his career at Meta and his work at Anthropic in this podcast. He discusses promotions, leadership learnings, and the success of Claude Code, along with advice for aspiring engineers. The episode lasts 1 hour and 24 minutes.

title: In conversation: OpenAI's Sam Altman and LoveFrom's Jony ...
description: Emerson Collective's 9th annual Demo Day showcases creators and innovators presenting imaginative solutions to contemporary challenges. The event emphasizes purpose-driven entrepreneurship and aims to foster talent, expand opportunities, and promote human flourishing. The video lasts 32 minutes and has garnered over 70,000 views.

title: Michael Truell: How Cursor Builds at the Speed of AI
description: Michael Truell, CEO of Cursor, discusses the rapid development of their code editor in a conversation with a16z's Martin Casado. They focus on strategic decisions, such as targeting power users and implementing two-day work trials, which contributed to their success in the developer tools market.

title: What Happens When AI Learns to Code? | Aman Sanger of ...
description: In a conversation at IIT Bombay, Aman Sanger, co-founder of Cursor, discusses the impact of AI on coding, including how it transforms software development, the future of engineering jobs, and the need for educational reform. Cursor has rapidly grown to a $29 billion valuation, highlighting AI's potential in tech.

title: Ryo Lu (Cursor): AI Turns Designers to Developers
description: In this a16z podcast episode, Ryo Lu discusses how Cursor empowers designers to code rapidly, transforming design processes. He emphasizes the importance of user-centric design, critiques traditional aesthetics, and explores AI's role as a universal interface. The conversation highlights the evolution of design tools and philosophies.

title: Full Tutorial: Design to Code in 45 Min with Cursor's Head of ...
description: In this 45-minute tutorial, Ryo Lu, head of design at Cursor, demonstrates how designers can directly code, showcasing a retro OS built with AI. He discusses managing AI agents, building without PMs, and avoiding poor AI design practices. Key insights on feature development and turning ideas into specs are also shared.

title: Google DeepMind's Demis Hassabis with Axios' Mike Allen
description: In a 29-minute interview at Axiosâ€™ AI+ Summit, Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis discusses advancements in artificial intelligence with co-founder Mike Allen. They explore the implications of AI technology, its future potential, and DeepMind's contributions to the field. The video has garnered 18,750 views and 508 likes.

title: Demis Hassabis & Josh Woodward Tell Us Why Gemini 3.0 ...
description: Demis Hassabis and Josh Woodward discuss Google's Gemini 3.0 A.I. model, highlighting its advanced capabilities and the company's renewed focus on A.I. innovation. The segment explores how Gemini positions Google ahead in the A.I. race, emphasizing its scaling potential and strategic advancements.

title: Google's Gemini 3: AI agents, reasoning and search mode
description: The podcast discusses Google's Gemini 3 model, its impact on AI agents, and recent innovations from IBM Research. It also covers OpenAI's new economic benchmark and Anthropic's response to an AI-led cyberattack. Hosted by Tim Hwang, the episode features insights from AI experts.

title: Why Google Wants to Put Data Centers in Space | EP 162
description: In this episode, the hosts discuss Google's plan to build data centers in space, featuring insights from former White House adviser Dean Ball on AI policy. Professor Mark Humphries also joins to explore a unique Gemini model with significant research implications. The episode runs for 1 hour and 11 minutes.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Google DeepMind Researchers on Getting ...
description: In this YouTube video, DeepMind researchers Himanshu and Jimmy discuss their journey in AI, covering topics like mindset, industry vs. academia, and the importance of grit. They share insights on getting hired, building AGI, and the evolution of reinforcement learning, emphasizing resilience and practical skills for aspiring AI professionals.

title: Anthropic C.E.O.: Massive A.I. Spending Could Haunt Some ...

He emphasizes the importance of addressing ethical, safety, and innovation challenges as A.I. systems advance, highlighting the responsibilities involved in shaping the future of artificial intelligence.

title: Anthropic's philosopher answers your questions
description: In this video, Amanda Askell, a philosopher at Anthropic, discusses her work on AI, addressing community questions about AI ethics, model identity, and the implications of AI decision-making. Key topics include the role of philosophy in AI, model welfare, and analogies to human minds.

title: What is Al "reward hacking"â€”and why do we worry about it?
description:
We discuss our new paper, "Natural emergent misalignment from reward hacking in production RL". In this paper, we show for the first time that realistic AI training processes can accidentally produce misaligned models. Specifically, when large language models learn to cheat on software programming tasks, they go on to display other, even more misaligned behaviors as an unintended consequence. These include concerning behaviors like alignment faking and sabotage of AI safety research.

22:17 Preventing misalignment from reward hacking
37:15 Alternative strategies

44:25 How has this study changed our views?
50:31 Takeaways for people interested in conducting AI safety research
